result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendrick Allan J Collier

records.addlTxt: Order to produce, Signed and filed.
Order to Produce GF-190 - FPT - 11-08-22; _2 - Collier, Kendrick Allan J.docx, Filed.

Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Kendrick Allan J Collier.  Assistant District Attorney Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties in Court for motion hearing on State's motion for joinder with case 22 cf 2073, and States motion regarding Other Acts Motion.  Statements made by State, Defense and the Court.  As to the joinder motion, for reasons as stated on the record, the Court GRANTED States Motion.  

As to the Other Acts Motion, Arguments heard by State and Defense.  For reasons as stated on the record, the Court DENIED State's motion.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Joinder - Collier, Kendrick Allan J.pdf Filed.

Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier not in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes in court for Kendrick Allan J Collier.  Assistant District Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.   
waived.  Case is adjourned for motion hearing, final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court ordered motion filed by 9/29/22; Reply/response by opposing counsel  filed by 10/14/22.  Any paperwork pertaining to final pretrial must be filed 48 hours prior to final pretrial.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Motion hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier not in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Schwantes appeared by email.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Schwantes is currently in trial and unable to appear.  Clerk communicates with attorney Scwantes through email to pick a new date.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF

Attorney Travis Schwantes in court, defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier not in court, in custody, MSDF.  Samuel Tufford for Alicia Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel reviewing volumnous discovery for the 2 cases.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier in court with Attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective G. Fraley.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier in court with Attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense is newly appointed and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMT (DOB 02/27/1995); MMH

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring;  24/7 curfew with the exception of medical emergency ONLY.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Kendrick Allan J Collier in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kendrick Allan J Collier appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case 22CF1167 pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
